The api url for the reservations API. Anything prefixed with `/` will be appended to `baseUrl`.

The number of minutes to be used as a fallback value for Reservation expiration duration in case no expiration date is passed in the api inputs and no default value is configured ## in OMS. Default value is 120 (minutes). Set this to 0 to pass no timeToExpire to IV reservation api call and let IV use its own default expiration duration.

This property takes all mapping types supported by elastic search to be defined for indexable attributes. By default we provide type, store and index. Any new mapping types can be added as comma separated value. Eg. yfs.index.field.mapping.types=type,store,index,<mapping_type> customers can add new values but can not remove existing values.

This property defines the data type for indexable attribute. Default value is set as blank. We expect customer to update the generate xml file with appropriate values for type. customers can set any valid elastic search data type as default value, then we will generate indexable xml with specified default value. We recommend keeping default value as blank.

This property is used by elastic search engine, we do not expect customers to modify these value. For any new mapping type default value can be specified as yfs.index.field.mapping.<mapping_type>.defaultvalue=<default_value> Refer to elasticsearch engine documentation for supported default values for any mapping types.

This property is used by elastic search engine, we do not expect customers to modify these value. For any new mapping type default value can be specified as yfs.index.field.mapping.<mapping_type>.defaultvalue=<default_value> Refer to elasticsearch engine documentation for supported default values for any mapping types.

This property is used by elastic search engine, we do not expect customers to modify these value. For any new mapping type default value can be specified as yfs.index.field.mapping.<mapping_type>.defaultvalue=<default_value> Refer to elasticsearch engine documentation for supported default values for any mapping types.

This property takes all mapping types to be defined for list elements and its child objects. By default we provide dynamic. Any new mapping types can be added as comma separated value. Eg. yfs.index.object.mapping.types=dynamic,<object_mapping_type> customers can add new values but can not remove existing values.

This property is used by elastic search engine, we do not expect customers to modify this value. For any new mapping type for object default value can be specified as Eg. yfs.index.object.mapping.<object_mapping_type>.defaultvalue=<default_value> Refer to elasticsearch engine documentation for supported default values for any mapping types.
At the time of elasticsearch client node initialization, check if it able to connect to the elasticsearch cluster. Allowed values: true | false Default: true
Time to wait (in seconds) for the connection to be established and the master node in the cluster to be available. This setting is only used for validation. Default: 5
The following set the out of box elasticsearch client type. Mandatory Valid Values : NodeClient, TransportClient and JestClient. Default Value : NodeClient

The TransportClient connects remotely to an elasticsearch cluster using the transport module. It does not join the cluster, but simply gets one or more initial transport addresses and communicates with them in round robin fashion on each action. Similarly the JestClient also requires an initial http host addresses to establish a connection with elasticsearch cluster. So if you want to use TransportClient or JestClient then it is mandatory to specify an initial host or hosts (separated by comma) to this property. for eg: yfs.elasticsearch.client.initial.hosts=host1,host2:port The transport client reads hosts from this property and sniffs other nodes in the cluster internally. JestClient is also configured to find other nodes in some time interval but it is better to specify all known Elasticsearch servers in the cluster to this property. The TransportClient uses port 9300 and JestClient uses 9200 by default. Elasticsearch servers are by default bind to port 9300 and 9200 for transport and http respectively. It is mandatory to specify port also to the IP address if Elasticsearch servers are bound to next available ports. If not specified then it will be defaulted from discovery.zen.ping.unicast.hosts. But if you set a Port Range along with IP address in the unicast.hosts property then it is mandatory to set this property as described above.

The properties given below are directly maps to elasticsearch.yml file. For each property, a short description is provided here. For more details on these properties, please refer to elasticsearch guide. All properties are either mandatory or optional. Mandatory properties are needed for successful client initialization. Such properties are identified in the comments as 'Mandatory'. Non-mandatory properties are marked as 'Optional'. Further, some properties are static and are NOT to be modified. They are here for informational purpose only, and will be validated during client startup. Such properties will be marked as 'Static' Set the below property to the 'cluster name' of the elasticsearch cluster. Mandatory
Set the below property with the list of elasticsearch hosts in the cluster. Mandatory for NodeClient for eg: discovery.zen.ping.unicast.hosts=host1,host2:port,host3[portX-portY]

The property given below is to set the time within which the client should become part of the cluster. Elasticsearch defaults it to 3s. Setting this property allows to specify a higher value to handle slow or congested networks to assure less chance of failure. Default = 10s Optional
Marks this node as elasticsearch client Default = true Mandatory for NodeClient, Static
Prevents the client from storing any indexing data Default = false Mandatory for NodeClient, Static
Disables 'multicast' mode of cluster detection. Default = false Mandatory for NodeClient, Static

Disables all HTTP/REST based access to the cluster through this client. For security reasons, it is strongly recommended to keep this disabled. If this property is removed, the internal default will be to keep HTTP access enabled. Allowed Values: true | false Default = false

The HOUR to run for triggering the process of extracting and sending metrics to success360 server. Default value is 1 and set this property to alter the hour. This should be set to a low useage time to prevent performance degradation. Contact the Sterling OMS Onboarding team to modify this value.

PropertyMetadata.Description: Set this property to Y to trace the communication to success360 server and the logic of the scheduling process.

Indicates whether your system supports COM. If COM is enabled, you can configure actions to call COM objects. Valid values: Y: (default) System supports COM. N: System does not support COM. Sample setting: yfs.comsupport=Y

Enables the configurator or health monitor to pop up a message asking the user to log back via the console. Valid values: Y: Enable popup message. N: (default) Do not enable popup message. Sample setting: yfs.config.password.noprompt=N
Sets the number of records needed before a dropdown list is displayed as a lookup text field. Default value is 75. Sample setting: yfs.config.lookuplimit=75
Decides if the application will act as thought http-only is set at the appserver. Default value is true.
API threshold in milliseconds. System default value used for the average response time for application servers. If this value is not specified, the default value is 20000 milliseconds.
System default value used for the pending jobs size for agents. If this value is not specified, the default value is 10000.
Application server threshold in milliseconds. System default value used for the average response time for APIs/services. If this value is not specified, the default value is 8000 milliseconds.
Health monitor purge interval in days. System default value used for purging heartbeat, snapshot, and page cache records. If this value is not specified, the default value is 30 days.

Required only when the database is Oracle and you have integration with Yantra DCS. Set this to the current value of the cursor_sharing parameter in your database. Find it in the v$parameter table of Oracle. When not set, the default value is FORCE. Valid values: FORCE: (default)
(For SSCAP) The interoperability agent will close a pooled connection if it has not been used for the timeout period specified by this property (in seconds). The default value is 10*60 seconds (600).

(For SSCAP) The frequency at which the connection reaper thread will examine the connection pool for connections that are eligible to be closed. However, the eligibility will be determined by the yfs.context.timeout property. The property is specified in seconds. The default value is 10*60 seconds (600).

The frequency at which the SMTP connection reaper thread will examine the connection pool for connections that are eligible to be closed. The connection will be eligible to be closed if the connection is idle for the number of seconds specified for the reaptime. The property is specified in seconds. The default value is 10*60 seconds (600).

The frequency at which the JMS connection reaper thread will examine the connection pool for connections that are eligible to be closed. The connection will be eligible to be closed if the connection is idle for the number of seconds specified for the reaptime. The property is specified in seconds. The default value is 10*60 seconds (600).

Indicates whether to enable or disable SMTP connection pooling. Valid values: true: (default) Enable SMTP connection pooling. IBM recommends setting this property to true for performance reasons. false: Disable SMTP connection pooling.

Specifies the JMS receive timeout value (in milliseconds). The JMS Receiver receives the next message that arrives within the specified timeout interval. The receive call blocks until a message arrives, the timeout expires, or this message consumer is closed. A timeout of zero never expires, and the call blocks indefinitely. If the default JMS server of WebSphere is used, then the receive timeout interval must be set to 60000 milliseconds (1 minute). Default: 1800000 milliseconds (30 minutes)

Indicates whether to disable JMS Session pooling. Enabling JMS Session pooling improves the Agent/Integration server performance. And in general it may introduce conflicts with the application servers' session pools but if JMS vendor is MQ & application server is WAS you can enable jms pooling always. Valid values: Y: (default) Disable JMS Session pooling. N: Enable JMS Session pooling.

Indicates whether to enable a generic proxy for JMS operations. When running into any queue specific issues enabling JMS Proxy helps to troubleshoot the issues. Valid values: false: (default) Disables jms proxy. true: Enables jms proxy.
Indicates whether to print the exception stack trace. Valid values: false: (default) Disables printing of exception stack trace. true: Prints the exception stack trace.
Indicates the log level for the debug statements in the jmx proxy. Valid values: Any valid Log Levels like ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, VERBOSE etc. Default value: DEBUG

Indicates whether single signon is enabled and the single signon class (yfs.login.singlesignon.class) is called. Valid values: Y: (default) Single signon is enabled. N: Single signon is disabled. Sample setting: yfs.security.singlesignon.enabled=Y

The class that handles single signon. Refer to the javadocs for the com.yantra.ycp.japi.util.YCPSSOManager interface for information about how to write your own implementation for this class. The default value is not set.

The class thats implements com.yantra.yfs.ui.backend.IYFSAuthenticateType interface needs to be implemented if single signon need to be skipped and platform authentication is needed. Refer to the javadocs for the com.yantra.yfs.ui.backend.IYFSAuthenticateType interface for information about how to write your own implementation for this class. The default value is not set.

Indicates when user validation against the singleSignOn Server is performed. Valid values: Y: Each request is validated against the singleSignOn Server for the user authentication. N: (default) User authentication against the singleSignOn Server is done only when the session times out.
This property must be set for the purge programs to run. It contains the absolute path to the directory where purge logs will be written. The default value is /opt/Sterling/runtime/logs

AgentServer Override for provider URL. Set the property to the provider URL which will be used by ALL Agent servers. This property does not impact integration servers configured in the service builder. This property overrides the URL configured for time-triggered transactions in config. Example for Weblogic: yfs.agent.override.providerurl=t3://<host>:<port> Example for WebSphere: yfs.agent.override.providerurl=corbaloc::<host>:<bootstrap port> Example for JBoss: yfs.agent.override.providerurl=jnp://<ipaddress>:<port> The default value is not set. Sample setting: yfs.agent.override.providerurl=t3://<ip Address>:<port>

AgentServer Override for InitialContextFactory Name. Set the property to the InitialContextFactory Name which will be used by ALL Agent servers. This property does not impact integration servers configured in the service builder. This property overrides the InitialContextFactory configured for time-triggered transactions in config. Example for WebSphere: yfs.agent.override.icf=com.ibm.websphere.naming.WsnInitialContextFactory Example for WebLogic: yfs.agent.override.icf=weblogic.jndi.WLInitialContextFactory Example for JBoss: yfs.agent.override.icf=org.jboss.naming.remote.client.InitialContextFactory The default value is not set. Sample setting: yfs.agent.override.icf=<InitialContextFactory Name>

AgentServer Override for JMS ConnectionFactory Name. Set the property to the ConnectionFactory Name which will be used by ALL Agent servers. This property does not impact integration servers configured in the service builder. This property overrides the JMS ConnectionFactory configured for time-triggered transactions in config. The default value is not set. Sample setting: yfs.agent.override.qcf=<ConnectionFactory Name>

AgentServer Override for RetryCount. Set the property to the JMS RetryCount to be used by ALL Agent Servers. This property does not impact integration servers configured in the service builder. Sample setting: yfs.agent.override.retryCount=<Number of Retries>

AgentServer Override for RetryInterval. Set the property to the JMS RetryInterval to be used by ALL Agent Servers. This property does not impact integration servers configured in the service builder. This interval is specified in milliseconds. The default value is not set. Sample setting: yfs.agent.override.retryInterval=<RetryInterval in milliseconds>

AgentServer Backup for JMS. Set this property to the JMSprovider URL which will be used by ALL Agent servers as a backup if the primary JMSServer becomes unavailable. The QueueName used by the Agent Server on the backup JMSServer will be the same as the one configured on the primary JMSServer. This property will be used only after a successful start of the Agent Server using the primary JMSServer configuration. If the AgentServer Override properties are specified, this property is used as a primary JMSServer property. The backup JMSServer will be used by the Agent Server only if yfs.agent.backup.providerurl, yfs.agent.backup.icf, and yfs.agent.backup.qcf are all specified. This property does not impact integration servers configured in the service builder. Example for WebSphere: yfs.agent.backup.providerurl=corbaloc::<host>:<boostrap port> Example for WebLogic: yfs.agent.backup.providerurl=t3://<host>:<port> Example for JBoss: yfs.agent.backup.providerurl=jnp://<ipaddress>:<port> The default value is not set. Sample setting: yfs.agent.backup.providerurl=t3://<ip Address>:<port>

AgentServer Backup for JMS. Set this property to the JMSprovider URL which will be used by ALL Agent servers as a Backup if the primary JMSServer becomes unavailable. The QueueName used by the Agent Server on the backup JMSServer will be the same as the one configured on the primary JMSServer. This property will be used only after a successful start of the Agent Server using the primary JMSServer configuration. If the AgentServer Override properties are specified, this property is used as a primary JMSServer property. The backup JMSServer will be used by the Agent Server only if yfs.agent.backup.providerurl, yfs.agent.backup.icf, and yfs.agent.backup.qcf are all specified. This property does not impact integration servers configured in the service builder. Example for WebSphere: yfs.agent.backup.icf=com.ibm.websphere.naming.WsnInitialContextFactory Example for WebLogic: yfs.agent.backup.icf=weblogic.jndi.WLInitialContextFactory Example for JBoss: yfs.agent.backup.icf=org.jboss.naming.remote.client.InitialContextFactory The default value is not set. Sample setting: yfs.agent.backup.icf=<InitialContextFactory Name>

AgentServer Backup for JMS. Set this property to the ConnectionFactory Name which will be used by ALL Agent servers as a Backup if the primary JMSServer becomes unavailable. The QueueName used by the Agent Server on the backup JMSServer will be the same as the one configured on the primary JMSServer. This property will be used only after a successful start of the Agent Server using the primary JMSServer configuration. If the AgentServer Override properties are specified, this is used as a primary JMSServer property. The backup JMSServer will be used by the Agent Server only if yfs.agent.backup.providerurl, yfs.agent.backup.icf, and yfs.agent.backup.qcf are all specified. This property does not impact integration servers configured in the service builder. The default value is not set. Sample setting: yfs.agent.backup.qcf=<ConnectionFactory Name>
Number of times to retry a failed JMS connection. Defaults to 0.
Number of milliseconds to wait between retries. Defaults to 0.

Indicates whether to enable the agent overrides to override the JMS Security parameter values specified in the Agent criteria. If set to Y, then the yfs.agent.override.auth.userid and yfs.agent.override.auth.password properties must be present. Valid values: Y: Enable agent overrides. N: Do not enable agent overrides.
Required if yfs.agent.override.auth.enabled=Y. User ID for the agent overrides to override the JMS Security parameter values specified in the Agent criteria. The default is not set.
Required if yfs.agent.override.auth.enabled=Y. User password for the agent overrides to override the JMS Security parameter values specified in the Agent criteria. The default is not set.

Indicates whether to enable the flow overrides to override the JMS Security parameter values specified in the service definition framework. If this value is set to Y, then the yfs.flow.override.auth.userid and yfs.flow.override.auth.password properties must be present; otherwise an error is thrown. No default is set. Valid values: Y: Enable the flow overrides. N: Do not enable the flow overrides. The default is not set.
User ID for the flow overrides to override the JMS Security parameter values specified in service definition framework.
User password for the flow overrides to override the JMS Security parameter values specified in the service definition framework.

The class that handles encryption and decryption of credit card numbers. Refer to the javadocs for the YCPEncrypter interface for information about how to write your own encrypter class. If this property is not specified, then no encryption will be performed.
The class that handles automated e-mail communication to and from the application. The default value is com.yantra.util.YFCEmailerImpl.
Handles encoding for e-mail communication to and from the application. The default value is UTF-8.

This class can be used to provide a custom URIResolver during XSL processing. Refer to the Java documentation for more information on this interface. If this property is not present, then the default implementation provided by the XSL processor is used. If set to com.yantra.interop.util.YantraDefaultURIResolver, then an attempt is made to resolve the URI within the classpath. If set to another class name, this class is used in place of the YantraDefaultURIResolver. The class given here must implement the javax.xml.transform.URIResolver interface. The default value is com.yantra.interop.util.YantraDefaultURIResolver.

Installation locale code. This code has to match the underlying operating system default time zone where the database is installed to avoid time zone calculation errors. If the base locale is changed to any other locale, this property should manually be changed to the same locale. The default value is en_US_EST, but for the On-Cloud instances it will be defaulted to en_US_UTC, which differs only on the time zone part as the OS of the servers on the cloud deployment are set to GMT time zone always.

(For SSCAP) Indicates whether to use the old date format that existed prior to Supply Chain application 5.5 version. Valid values: Y: Use the old date format that existed prior to Supply Chain application 5.5 version. N: (default) Do not use the old date format that existed prior to Supply Chain application 5.5 version.

The class that will be invoked for user authentication. Uncomment and change this property only if you *DO NOT* want to use application authentication. Refer to the javadocs for the YFSAuthenticator interface for information about how to write your own implementation for this class. If you want to use the default implementation for LDAP authentication, uncomment the property and set it to com.yantra.yfs.util.YFSLdapAuthenticator.

The LDAP context factory classname as specified in your LDAP server configuration. Uncomment and change this property only if you use the default LDAP authentication implementation. The default value is com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory. Sample setting: yfs.security.ldap.factory=com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory

The URL for accessing your LDAP server as specified in your LDAP server configuration. Uncomment and change this property only if you use the default LDAP authentication implementation. Sample setting: yfs.security.ldap.url=ldap://<ldapservername>:<portnum>
The value specified for the organizational unit in your LDAP server configuration. Uncomment and change this property only if you use the default LDAP authentication implementation.
The value specified for the organization in your LDAP server configuration. Uncomment and change this property only if you use the default LDAP authentication implementation.

When this property is turned on (set to Y), errors encountered are directed to the alert console. Errors are grouped by certain criteria. Not every error is a separate entry in the alert console. Valid values: Y: (default) Direct errors to the alert console. N: Do not direct errors to the alert console.

This property is to set the logging interval. If it is set to 'day' then errors will be grouped on daily basis. Otherwise, they are grouped on an hourly basis. If an error is repeated within a logging interval, it is not directed multiple times to alert console. Instead, the alert entry shows an increased occurrence count. Valid values: day : (default) Errors grouped daily. hour : Errors grouped hourly.

This property controls how many days of inactivity are required before the alert is eligible to be automatically closed by the Inbox Purge Agent. The default value is 7 days. A value of 0 means the alert will never be closed by this agent.
The QUEUE_KEY of the queue to which the alert should be assigned. The default value is no queue.

If you wish to install the Java plugin (used for the configurator and HSDEs) in intranet environments, configure this parameter to point to the location of the plugin. If this is not configured, the configurator uses the default value of http://java.sun.com/update/1.4.2/jinstall-1_4_2_03-windows-i586.cab. For more details, refer to http://java.sun.com/products/archive/j2se/1.4.2/jre/install-windows.html.

(For SSCAP) Used by the application to tell the JDBC driver the number of rows that should be fetched from the database when more rows are needed. The default value is not set. DO NOT UNCOMMENT OR DEFINE THIS PROPERTY UNLESS INSTRUCTED BY AN IBM TECHNICAL SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL
Controls the encoding of the HTML sent to the client. The default value is UTF-8.

This property controls the encoding of the files, like API template, theme XMLs, exception template (except e-mail templates which are controlled by yfs.email.template.encoding). The default value is UTF-8.

The number of records displayed on a list screen. Increase the application server JVM heap settings if these parameters are increased. The change will affect search limits for all users. The default value is 200.

The default number of records returned by application list APIs. Increase the application server JVM heap settings if these parameters are increased. The change will affect the search limits for all users. The default value is 5000.

The number of seconds that the Application Console will wait for a SQL Statement to execute. If the limit is exceeded, an SQLException is thrown. Set to zero (0) means unlimited. The default value is 60.

This property can be set to Y when developing and customizing the Application Console UI. IMPORTANT: This property should NOT be set to Y for live production systems because the refresh only works for a single user development environment. Valid values: Y: Refresh actions will be available within the Resource Configurator screens. These actions can be used to refresh the resources used in the Console UI Framework without having to restart the application server. N: (default) The actions will be disabled, and it will be necessary to restart the application server whenever any resource is changed within the configurator.

Request queue time-to-live in seconds for Synchronous JMS messages. Note that this property is a global level override and is applicable for all the services using Synchronous JMS. WARNING: If this property value is set beyond the responseTimeOut value, it may result in unprocessed request messages in the reply/response queue. By default, in order to clean up the unprocessed messages from the reply/response queue, the timeToLive for request messages is set to the responseTimeOut value of the receiver.

Request queue timetolive in seconds for Synchronous JMS messages. Note that this property is applicable only for the specified service. WARNING: If this property value is set beyond the responseTimeOut value, it may result in unprocessed request messages in the reply/response queue. By default, in order to clean up the unprocessed messages from the reply/response queue, the timeToLive for request messages is set to the responseTimeOut value of the receiver.
Indicates whether an authorization check is performed on a user's access to an API when the user calls that API. Valid values: Y: (default) Enable API security. N: Do not enable API security.

Indicates if the login API will return a special UserToken security token attribute upon successful authentication. The api.security.token.timeout property controls how long this token is active. Valid values: Y: (default) Enable token handling for authentication checks. N: Do not enable token handling for authentication checks.

Indicates whether the API security layer is enabled for the JSP console, in addition to the built-in security. Valid values: Y: Enable API security for the JSP console. N: (default) Do not enable API security for the JSP console.

Indicates whether the API security layer is enabled for the configurator and the system monitor console, in addition to the built-in security. Valid values: Y: Enable API security for the configurator and the system monitor console. N: (default) Do not enable API security for the configurator and the system monitor console.

If api.security.enabled=Y, then this property sets the security mode (STRICT, LAX, DEBUG). Note: If you do not specify a security mode, then the system defaults to the STRICT mode. Valid values: STRICT: (default) If any validation fails, throw an exception. This is appropriate for production systems, if all permissions are configured properly. LAX: Filter out and and log invalid input, but continue processing. The filtering allows the system to mostly work despite incorrect input or output, while the logging helps to identify places that need change. DEBUG: Log invalid input and output, but do not filter anything or throw exceptions. This is only appropriate during intial development, to identify the permissions required by various processes.
Timeout for the security token (in milliseconds). Sample setting: api.security.token.timeout=1800000

Set this property to true if you want the application server to authenticate a user, and the user ID must match the requested user ID. Valid values: true: The application server authenticates the user. false: (default) The application server does not authenticate the user.

Setting this property to true will validate the user token supplied as a parameter on the request. When enabled, this also allows access to the login API, which is what supplies the user token. Valid values: true: (default) Validate the user token and allow access to the login API. false: Do not validate the user token and allow access to the login API.

Indicates whether to require that the user ID and password must be passed as parameters to the servlet. Valid values: true: (default) The user ID and password must be passed as parameters to the servlet. false: The user ID and password do not have to be passed as parameters to the servlet.
(For SSCAP) DO NOT MODIFY THIS PROPERTY This property is used by the Multi-Channel Fulfillment Solution internally. Do not change it or remove it.
(For SSCAP) DO NOT MODIFY THIS PROPERTY This property is used by the Multi-Channel Fulfillment Solution internally. Do not change it or remove it.
Indicates whether to turn on statistics logging. Valid values: Y: Turn on statistics logging. N: (default) Do not turn on statistics logging.

Statistics logging time interval. Format of the property is Xm or Xh where X is an integer between 1 and 60 and M/m is for minutes or H/h is for hours. If a value of 61m or greater is specified, it will be reduced to 60m. If a value of 25h or greater is specified, it will be reduced to 24h. If the units are minutes (M/m), then the value is rounded up or down to the nearest equal divisor of 60 minutes. Valid values for minutes are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 20 or 30. If the units are hours (H/h), then the value is rounded up or down to the nearest equal divisor of 24 hours. Valid values for hours are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8 or 12. If any unrecognized value or unit is specified, it will default to 10m (minutes).

PropertyMetadata.Description: Class that implements com.yantra.yfc.statistics.interfaces.PLTStatisticsConsumer interface. The interface provides a way to publish statistics data collected by the application.

Indicates the time interval before statistics are collected and published to external consumers. Format of the property is Xm or Xh where X is an integer between 1 and 60 and M/m is for minutes or H/h is for hours. If a value of 61m or greater is specified, it will be reduced to 60m. If a value of 25h or greater is specified, it will be reduced to 24h. If the units are minutes (M/m), then the value is rounded up or down to the nearest equal divisor of 60 minutes. Valid values for minutes are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 20 or 30. If the units are hours (H/h), then the value is rounded up or down to the nearest equal divisor of 24 hours. Valid values for hours are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8 or 12. If any unrecognized value or unit is specified, it will default to 2m (minutes).
PropertyMetadata.PermissibleValues: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <Values> <Value Name="1m"/> <Value Name="2m"/> <Value Name="3m"/> <Value Name="4m"/> <Value Name="5m"/> <Value Name="6m"/> <Value Name="10m"/> <Value Name="12m"/> <Value Name="15m"/> <Value Name="20m"/> <Value Name="30m"/> <Value Name="1h"/> <Value Name="2h"/> <Value Name="3h"/> <Value Name="4h"/> <Value Name="6h"/> <Value Name="8h"/> <Value Name="12h"/> </Values>

PropertyMetadata.Description: Determines the heartbeat refresh time interval. As a best practice, the value for this property should be greater than the value for yantra.statistics.persist.interval. The format of the property is Xm or Xh where X is an integer between 1 and 60 and M/m for minutes or H/h for hours. If any unrecognized value or unit is specified, it will default to 10m (minutes). If a value of 61m or greater is specified, it will be reduced to 60m. If a value of 25h or greater is specified, it will be reduced to 24h. If the units are minutes (M/m), then the value is rounded up or down to the nearest equal divisor of 60 minutes. Valid values for minutes are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 20 or 30. If the units are hours (H/h), then the value is rounded up or down to the nearest equal divisor of 24 hours. Valid values for hours are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8 or 12. If any unrecognized value or unit is specified, it will default to 10m (minutes). IBM recommends that the value of this property should be set greater than the value of the yantra.statistics.persist.interval property.
PropertyMetadata.PermissibleValues: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <Values> <Value Name="1m"/> <Value Name="2m"/> <Value Name="3m"/> <Value Name="4m"/> <Value Name="5m"/> <Value Name="6m"/> <Value Name="10m"/> <Value Name="12m"/> <Value Name="15m"/> <Value Name="20m"/> <Value Name="30m"/> <Value Name="1h"/> <Value Name="2h"/> <Value Name="3h"/> <Value Name="4h"/> <Value Name="6h"/> <Value Name="8h"/> <Value Name="12h"/> </Values>

PropertyMetadata.Description: Indicates whether to handle namespaces in XML. Valid values: Y: Handle namespaces in XML. N: (default) Do not handle namespaces in XML.

Indicates whether to enable printing via the TCP/IP Socket Interface or via the the File Interface (file "drop" to a shared network drive). Although the default value has been set to N for the sake of backward compatibility, IBM's recommendation is to set this flag to Y. Valid values: Y: Enable printing via the TCP/IP Socket Interface. N: (default) Enable printing via the File Interface.
Set this property to WAIT to change the Loftware print server's mode to the WAIT mode. Valid values: WAIT NOWAIT (default)
The interval (in seconds) at which tasks need to be polled for mobile operators. The default value is 60.

If both the Request Delivery date and Request Ship date are passed, setting this property will compute the transit time as the difference between these two dates, and no further transit time computation will be required. Valid values: Y: The transit time is the difference between the Request Delivery date and the Request Ship date. N: (default) The transit time is not the difference between the Request Delivery date and the Request Ship date.
The length to which the error message to be stored in the YFS_REPROCESS_ERROR table should be truncated. When not set, default value is 4000.
Indicates whether to disable caching of application pages. Valid values: Y: Disable caching of application pages. N: (default) Do not disable caching of application pages.

IMPORTANT: The updates cache directory MUST NOT point to same location. The cache directory is a working directory and involves file I/O, e.g., file creations and deletionas, etc. Example: yfs.rcp.pca.updates.dir=<updates_directory>

A local cache directory where the updates need to be cached. IMPORTANT: The updates cache directory MUST NOT point to the same location as the yfs.rcp.pca.updates.dir directory. The cache directory is a working directory and involves file I/O, e.g., file creations and deletions, etc. Example: yfs.rcp.pca.updates.cache.dir=<updates_directory> The default value is not set.

Set this property to Y to run the Rich Client application in RCP dev mode. When a Rich Client application is run in RCP dev mode, the server-side RCP validations are not done, such as commands validation for security purposes. The default value is N. Valid values: Y: Run application in RCP dev mode. N: (default) Do not run application in RCP dev mode.
Indicates whether Text Search is to be enabled. Valid values: Y: Enable Text Search. N: (default) Do not enable Text Search.
The type of text index in Oracle. Valid values: CTXCAT (default) CONTEXT
Defines custom compression logic. The given class must implement SCICustomDataCompressor. Sample setting: db.compression.class=<classname>
Indicates whether to enable or disable auditing. Valid values: Y: (default) Auditing enabled. N: Auditing disabled.

The query timeout for Agents (in seconds). The global property applicable for all agents. It is possible for individual agents to override this property by specifying their own query timeouts. For example, the User Activity Audit Purge Agent can specify a property like USERACTAUDITPRG.queryTimeout. This will override this global property. Set to zero (0) means unlimited. The default value is not set.
Number of records shown on a paginated list page. The default value is 30.

Indicates whether to insert instance number into primary keys generated. Valid values: Y: Insert instance number into primary keys generated. N: (default) Do not insert instance number into primary keys generated.

A URL to use if the sytem needs to redirect to some custom URL upon error in the login page. If not specified, it will redirect to the default login page. This property can be specified in the yfs.properties_ext file. The default value is not set. Sample setting: yfs.login.redirect.url=<REDIRECT_URL>
User ID for creating a queue connection with the specified user identity.
User password for creating a queue connection with the specified user identity.
Overrides the XML root tag name for event XML.

Indicates whether to use the case sensitive or case insensitive search mode. Though this mode is globally applicable across entities, it can be overridden at a particular entity or column level. To enable case insensitivity at an entity level, use the following format: <ENTITY_NAME>.CaseInsensitiveSearch.Mode=ENABLED Example: YFS_INBOX.CaseInsensitiveSearch.Mode=ENABLED To enable case insensitivity at a column level, use the following format: <ENTITY_NAME>.<COLUMN_NAME>.CaseInsensitiveSearch.Mode=ENABLED Example: YFS_INBOX.ALERT_TYPE.CaseInsensitiveSearch.Mode=ENABLED Valid values: DISABLED: Search is case sensitive. Search is done on the original column only. ENABLED: (default) Search is case insensitive. Search is done on the shadow column, which is generated once this attribute is set. MIXED: Search is done on both the original and shadow columns. This mode is useful only during data migration (while populating the shadow column).
The batch size for executebatch. The default value is set to 10000.

Indicates whether the system will create multiple entries for bundle entries for different locales. When trying to load literals for a given locale, if the properties file is not found for the locale, the system will use the default locale (en_US) for string translations. Valid values: Y: The system will create multiple entries for bundle entries for different locales. N: The system will not create multiple entries for bundle entries for different locales.
Example for Oracle hint for YFS_TASK_Q table: yfs.<agent_criteria_id>.getjobs.hint.outer=/*+ parallel(YFS_TASK_Q 8) full(yfs_task_q) */
Example for Oracle hint for YFS_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS yfs.<agent_criteria_id>.getjobs.hint.inner=/*+ NL_AJ */
The class used for reading the client IP from the request. Refer to the Javadoc of the YFSClientIPReader interface for information about how to write your own client IP reader class.
Sets the header name present in the HTTP request, which stores the client IP address. The default implementation reads the value of this header and sets it as the IP address.

Based on this flag, the default implementation will read the value of the request header 'X-Forwarded-For' to get the IP address. If this flag is Y, and the property yfs.clientip.httprequest.ipHeaderAttribute is also supplied, then the IP header attribute is given preference. Valid values: Y: Use the IP header attribute to the get the IP address. N: (default) Use the request header 'X-Forwarded-For' to get the IP address.
Indicates whether error message detail is shown on the console login screen when the login fails. Valid values: Y: Error message detail is shown. N: (default) Error message detail is not shown.

Indicates whether the system appends a unique numeric ID (exception ID) to the description of an error. The exception ID is based on the yfs.exception.display.uniqueExceptionId property. See also the yfs.exception.display.uniqueExceptionId property for displaying the exception ID in the error description or as an attribute in the error XML. Valid values: Y: System does not append a unique numeric ID to the error description. N: (default) System appends a unique numeric ID to the error description.
Prefix to add the JNDI name when performing an EJB lookup in the client API library. If not set, then no prefix is used.

Indicates whether to display the unique exception ID in the error description or in the error XML. Note: This property is used only if yfs.exception.disable.uniqueExceptionId=N. Valid values: Description: (default) The unique exception ID is displayed in the error description. XML: The unique exception ID is displayed as a new attribute in the error XML.

Sets the Initial Context factory for WebLogic, which will be used to look up the Queue JNDI name supplied at the time adding the Queue to the monitorables in the System management console. The default value is weblogic.jndi.WLInitialContextFactory, which is used if nothing is specified. Sample setting: yfs.hm.jmsMonitorable.naming.factory.initial=weblogic.jndi.WLInitialContextFactory
Indicates whether to escalate alerts even if the alert is not assigned to a specific user. Valid values: Y: Escalate alerts. N: (default) Do not escalate alerts.
Modify this property to change the default expire time (in seconds) for an access token. The default value of this property is 1800
Modify this property to change the maximum allowed expire time (in seconds) for an access token. The default value of this property is 1800
System prints the document if a document has more than million node. Set this property to true if you do not that document to get printed. The default value of this property is false.

If you want to use Index GUID format like <random number>:<counter>:<timestamp>:<hostname>:<node> Set this property as true. By default it is false and format is: <hostname>:<node>:< timestamp>:<counter>
If you want the passwords to be output for api's getDBPoolList, getDBConnParams Set this property as true. By default it is false

This property declares a range of ports that will be used when exporting the server RMI object. A single unused port in the range will be selected for use. The syntax of a range is <minport>-<maxport>, and multiple ranges may be given when separated by a comma. Example: rmi.portrange=17800-17850 Example: rmi.portrange=17800-17850, 18000, 18820-18830 If an open port cannot be found, an exception will occur. Port number 0 indicates any available port may be used. The default value is 0. Sample setting: rmi.portrange=0
This property should hold the fully qualified name of the class implementing the ISCCallOutManager interface.
This property holds the base directory path that will be prepended to the callout class loader directory
Specifies the JMS Response message time to live value (in seconds). This value can be overridden at the service configuration level. Default: 0 seconds which means the message lives indefinitely

SOAP spec states that "The correlation ID of the JMS reply message should be set to the message ID of the original JMS request message." Enable this flag by setting it to Y if the correlation ID of the JMS reply message has to be set to the message ID of the original JMS request message. Valid values: Y: Force SOAP spec regardless of the configuration at the service level. N: (default) Pick up the configuration at the service level.

This property is mandatory for Platform's File Upload/Download Functionality. Specifies the absolute file path to a directory that will temporarily hold uploaded files. When file information is sent to the database, files will be read from this directory. There is no default directory. If the directory is not specified, the file upload fails.

To be configured for File Upload/Download Functionality. Used in connection with Virus Scanner which can be plugged in for Virus check during file upload and download. See also - sc.file.upload.virus.scanner

Specifies the maximum size of the file that can be uploaded per installation, specified either in bytes (B), kilobytes (KB), megabytes (MB) or gigabytes (GB). The default value is 10 MB. To have no file size limit, the value should be -1. Use sc.file.upload.maxfilesize.<table_name> to specify the maximum size of the file that can be uploaded for a table whose name is <table_name>, for example, sc.file.upload.maxfilesize.YFS_USER=[something].

Specifies the file types that can be uploaded per installation. The default allowed file types are *.pdf, *.txt, and *.doc. To have no restrictions on the allowed file types, set the property to all. Note: if the defaulted values are removed, then an exception will be thrown during the file upload. Use the sc.file.upload.allowedfiletypes.<table_name> property to specify the file types that can be uploaded for the specified table. The <table_name> variable is the parent table name for which files are being attached.

Specifies when to upload a file to the server. Valid values: * ONSELECT (the default value): Files would be sent to the server after the file is selected and after validations are successful. The files are streamed to the server for placement in a temporary location. * ONSUBMIT, the following happens: * (WUF) Platform would intercept the Ajax request, upload all the files, and then make the Ajax request. * (RCP) The file is uploaded to the server before the API call to send file information to the database. On an API call within the context of a file upload, the files are sent across to the server. When there is confirmation that the files are placed on the server, the actual API call is made.

The fully qualified Java class path of the file which should extend the IVirusScanner interface, which is intended to be used with file upload/download functionality. This is not a mandatory property. In case of a class not found or any other Exception, while instantiating the class, an Exception will be thrown and the upload process fails.

Used to plug in the encoder/decoder. This is the fully qualified Java classpath. In the case of an exception, while instantiating the class, an exception will be thrown and the upload process fails. Files are encoded by objects of the IFileEncoderDecoder interface, which has two methods (encode and decode).

Used to plug in implementation, to perform secure file delete from the temporary location of the server. Value of the property is fully qualified Java classpath of the implementation class. In case of an exception, while instantiating the class, an exception will be thrown. Implemenatation class has to implement interface ISecureFileDelete.

The property can be used to disable access to and operations on all history tables. To prevent database operations on history tables, set the property to true. To disable history table access for specific colony, use the following format: yfs.api.history.disable.colony.<COLONY_ID>=true, where COLONY_ID refers colonyid of the colony Example: yfs.api.history.disable.colony.Colony01=true

This property controls whether the "xmlns" attribute will be present in API output. This attribute will only be present in the output when it is also present in the input. The default value is false. Example: api.output.namespace.enabled=false

This property controls the behavior when a List is fired across multiple colonies and one or more of these colonies are disabled. A value of true will simply ignore these colonies, while a value of false will cause an exception to be thrown. Note a value of true will not prevent an exception in all circumstances. For example, if a given input resolves directly to a disabled colony, then an exception is still likely. The default value is false. Example: shard.ignoreDisabledColonies=false

The property can be used to specify ehcache disk storage directory. If set, then it overrides disk store path set in ehcache cache configuration file. System will create a sub-directory, for each jvm, within this directory and ehcache creates .data and .index files in the sub-direcotry. The name of sub-directory can be specified by using system argument jvmcacheid. If the argument is not passed then ServerId of the server is used as sub-directory name.

If you want the guest user locale to be fetched only from the locale defined for the guest user in the database set the property value to Y. Otherwise the guest user locale will be figured from the browser request. If it can not be derived from the browser request then it will be derived from database. The default value is N. Valid values: Y: Fetch the guest user locale from database N: (default) Try to figure out the guest user locale from browser request. If it can not be found then from database.

Indicates whether an authorization check is performed on a user's access to a configurator or system management console servlet when the user calls that servlet. Valid values: true: (default) Enable servlet authorization. false: Do not enable servelt authorization.

The property can be used to prevent api exceptions to be logged multiple times. Once by platform backend layer i.e., afc and twice by uifwk impl layer. If this property is set to Y, uifwk impl will not log api exceptions. The default value is N. Valid values: Y: uifwk impl will not log api exception N: (default) uifwk impl will log api exceptions.

This property can be used to enable the bulk message sending in agents. If this property to true, the JMS messages are added in batches in the internal JMS queue. The messages received from the 'getJobs' method are divided into batches and if this property is set to Y, each of these batch messages are sent to the JMS Queue using a single JMS connection or session. This improves the performance of an agent server. Also note if user enables the session pooling (by setting yfs.jms.session.disable.pooling=N), the sessions will be reused among different batches. Otherwise, a new session is created for each batch of the messages. The default value of this property is N.

This property can be used to set the number of messages to be sent using single QueueSender. This property is applicable only if agent.bulk.sender.enabled is set to Y. The default value is 1, which means after each send system will re-create the QueueSender. The optimum value of the property may vary between different JMS vendors.
Control the encoding of string from received jms text message. The default value is UTF-8.

Flash player accepts object parameters such as AllowScriptAccess Modify this property to change the default value for "allowScriptAccess" Controls the value which permits the ActonScript-to-JavaScript calls The default value of this property is "sameDomain"
If ThreadPoolExecutorService is used for parallel processing, this property determines the core pool size for the internal thread pool. Default: 10
If ThreadPoolExecutorService is used for parallel processing, this property determines the max pool size for the internal thread pool. Default: 50

If ThreadPoolExecutorService is used for parallel processing, this property determines the keep-alive time (in milli-seconds) for the idle threads of the internal thread pool. Default: 10000 (10 seconds)

If ThreadPoolExecutorService is used for parallel processing, this property determines the size of the internal queue that is used for queuing submitted tasks (or works). Permissible values: - A negative value implies an unbounded queue. - A value of '0' implies direct handoff (causing the submitted task to run immediately on a new or idle thread). Tasks will NOT be queued for later execution, and such tasks will be treated based on the property 'threadPool.worker.rejectionPolicy'. - A positive value will determine the size of the bounded queue. Once the queue size is reached, any new tasks are treated based on the property 'threadPool.worker.rejectionPolicy' Default: -1 (unbounded queue)

If ThreadPoolExecutorService is used for parallel processing, this property determines its behavior upon task submission once the internal queue has reached its limits. Permissible values: - callerRuns: The submitted task is run on the caller's thread once the task queue is full - abort: Throw a java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException once the task queue is full - discard: The submitted task is quietly discarded once the task queue is full - discardOldest: The oldest task in the queue is discarded, making room for the submitted task - <class that implements java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionHandler>: The fully qualified classname of a class that implements RejectedExecutionHandler. Default: callerRuns

This property controls the behavior when an event is raised for an enterprise and event handler is configured for both the enterprise and HUB. A value of true will invoke handler for both the enterprise and HUB, while a value of false will invoke ## handler for only the enterprise. The default value is true.
Comma separated value of custom greex functions. Each value should be a full package name of a class that implements com.yantra.ycp.greex.library.LibraryFunction interface.

Indicates whether the server needs to start as an edge server. Valid values: N: (default) Server starts in normal mode. Y: Server starts in edge deployment mode. Sample setting: yfs.enableedgedeployment=N
This property controls the caching behaviour of the housekeeping fields of the table YFS.RESOURCE in the database. False value, will cache the housekeeping field.
This property controls the caching behaviour of the housekeeping fields of the table YFS.MENU in the database. False value, will cache the housekeeping field.
Indicates whether the Entity Transaction Cache is enabled. Setting to false will disable the Entity Transaction Cache for all tables.

Indicates whether the Entity Transaction Cache is enabled for the given table. Valid values: true: (default) Enable caching. false: Disable caching. Example: YFS_COMMON_CODE.entity.transactioncache.enabled=true
Default maximum size of the "count" Entity Transaction Cache for a given table. This is the number of select statements that count records that will be cached. The default value is 10000.
Default maximum size of the "select" Entity Transaction Cache for a given table. This is the number of select statements that return a single record that will be cached. The default value is 10000.
Default maximum size of the "list" Entity Transaction Cache for a given table. This is the number of select statements that return multiple records that will be cached. The default value is 10000.

An override of the "count" Entity Transaction Cache size for the given table. The default value is the value of entity.transactioncache.count.size. Example: YFS_COMMON_CODE.entity.transactioncache.count.size=5000

An override of the "select" Entity Transaction Cache size for the given table. The default value is the value of entity.transactioncache.select.size. Example: YFS_COMMON_CODE.entity.transactioncache.select.size=5000

An override of the "list" Entity Transaction Cache size for the given table. The default value is the value of entity.transactioncache.list.size. Example: YFS_COMMON_CODE.entity.transactioncache.list.size=5000

This property of format yfs.ibmid.provisioner.<provisiner name>.logouturl is used to provide the logout url for the ibmid provisioner chosen in yfs.ibmid.provisioner.name. This is the URL to which the application should redirect the user to terminate the IBMID session.

This property of format yfs.ibmid.provisioner.<provisiner name>.logouturl is used to provide the logout url for the ibmid provisioner chosen in yfs.ibmid.provisioner.name. This is the URL to which the application should redirect the user to terminate the IBMID session.
Hostname/ip of the SFTP server of the customer where dataextract files are to be transferred
Port of SFTP server of the customer where dataextract files are to be transferred Sample setting: yfs.coc.dataextract.sftp.port=22
Directory location in the SFTP server of the customer where dataextract files are to be transferred
Username of the SFTP server of the customer where dataextract files are to be transferred
Password of the SFTP server of the customer where dataextract files are to be transferred
This property sets how long an EOF message is kept in the table before trying to process it. This is set in seconds and default value is 300 seconds
This property set how often we'll poll for records over the yfs.eof.wait.time value. This is set in seconds and default value is 60 seconds
The default value 'true' tracks all messages. Setting to false simply waits for yfs.eof.wait.time to pass.
This property is the interval in which we'll collect unique message ids that should be checked for completion. This is set in milliseconds and default value is 2000 milliseconds.

If an API is run with VERBOSE level of tracing enabled, then at the end of the successful execution of the API, certain data such as API input, configuration, and select master data that were accessed during the API execution, are dumped in the form of an XML into the standard log file. The default value is ON_ERROR.
PropertyMetadata.PermissibleValues: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <Values> <Value Name="NONE"/> <Value Name="ON_VERBOSE"/> <Value Name="ON_ERROR"/> <Value Name="ON_ERROR_AND_VERBOSE"/> </Values>

PropertyMetadata.Description: The SSL CIPHER SUIT used by health monitor agent when connecting to a websphere MQ Channel with SSL enabled. For eg: SSL_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA, which is the CipherSuite for CipherSpec TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA

Indicates whether YFS_ZIP_CODE_LOCATION table records should be part of CDT import/export Valid values: Y: (default) Ignore YFS_ZIP_CODE_LOCATION as part of CDT import/export N: Do not ignore YFS_ZIP_CODE_LOCATION as part of CDT import/export
String used as delimiter for CSV file column values. New-line or double-quote cannot be used in the string. Default - ,
Whether the data extract CSV file should have a new line at the end of last record row Valid values: Y: New line at the end of last record row N: (default) No new line at the end of last record row

Whether the data extract CSV file should have column names as headers in the first row Valid values: Y: Column names are present as headers in the first row N: (default) No column names as headers in the first row
Maximum number of rows extracted in one job capped at, in case number arrived at from internal memory calculations is higher Default - 50000
Maximum hours prior to the current time for which data would not be extracted Valid values are 1 or higher integers Default - 1

Indicates whether to enable JMS Producer caching for services. Enabling this means that JMS producers will not be recreated everytime, to send messages to JMS Destionations. The same existing JMS Producer under a given JMS Session will be reused to send messages to JMS Destinations. This will remove the overhead of recreating JMS Producers for each message send. Note that this caching is applicable only for JMS message sends using services and not through agents. Also note that this is effective only when JMS session pooling is enabled in the product because otherwise, JMS sessions are not reused and thus JMS producers also cannot be reused. Valid values: false: (default) Disable JMS Producer caching for services. true: Enable JMS Producer caching for a JMS Session.

Indicates the number of times a JMS producer will be reused, if JMS producer caching is enabled. Once the JMS producer has been reused till the limit, then it is closed and a fresh JMS Producer is created for sending a message using the same JMS Session. Note that this property is applicable only when JMS Producer caching is enabled for services. Default: 5000

Indicates whether to enable extra messages are logged in the log files for JMS related operations. If this property is enabled, additional INFO level messages are logged in the log file for various JMS operations. E.g. connection creation timings, session creation and closing timings etc. These messages are helpful in monitoring performance of operations of JMS components in an SDF service. Valid values: false: (default) Disable JMS debug messages true: Enable JMS debug messages

This property is applicable only when jms debug is enabled. If this property is set to 'n', then a tracing statement priting total time for message send, will be logged after every 'n' message sends done by each thread to a jms destination defined in an SDF service. The value of this property should be greater than 0. Default: 1000

This property is applicable only when jms debug is enabled. If this property is set to 'n', then a tracing statement printing total time, will be logged after every 'n' JMS Producer (Sender) creations done by a thread. The value of this property should be greater than 0. Default: 1000

This property is applicable only when jms debug is enabled. If this property is set to 'n', then a tracing statement printing total time, will be logged after every 'n' JMS Producer (Sender) Commits done by a thread. The value of this property should be greater than 0. Default: 1000

This property is applicable only when jms debug is enabled. If this property is set to 'n', then a tracing statement priting total number of sessions in session pool, will be logged after every 'n' fetch requests made to the pool, across all threads. The value of this property should be greater than 0. Default: 1000

This property is used to load the verification key which is to be used for JSON Web Token (JWT) signature verification. This property can also be configured for a specific issuer of the JWT, using the property 'yfs.jwt.<issuer name>.verify.keyloader' Valid values: jkstruststore : (default) the verification key is searched in the jks trustore of the JVM which is specified at the start of the JVM by using the system properties -Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=<truststore location> -Djavax.net.ssl.trustStorePassword=<trust store password>. The alias name to search the key in trust store is the 'kid' value received in the JWT. properties : the verification key is read from a yfs property 'yfs.jwt.verify.propkeyloader.<kid>' where <kid> is the 'kid' header param received in the JWT. The value of the property 'yfs.jwt.verify.propkeyloader.<kid>' must be a BASE64 encoded public key. httpsjwks : the verification key is obtained from an http(s) URL. The response obtained from the URL must be in JWKS format. The value of the URL is specied by the property 'yfs.jwt.verify.keyloader.httpsuri'. If https URI is used, then the certificate of this URL may need to be added to the JVM trust store to enable successful connection to the URI. httpsjwk : the verification key is obtained from an http(s) URL. The response obtained from the URL must be in JWK format. The value of the URL is specied by the property 'yfs.jwt.verify.keyloader.httpsuri'. If https URI is used, then the certificate

This property is applicable only when the property 'yfs.jwt.verify.keyloader' is set to either httpsjwks, httpsjwk or httpsbase64. This is used to specify the http(s) URI which will be used to fetch the verification key to be used for verifying the JWT. The response returned by this URI must be in a format which corresponds to the value of property 'yfs.jwt.verify.keyloader'. If https URI is used, then the certificate of this URI may need to be added to the JVM trust store to enable successful connection to the https URI. This property can also be configured for a specific issuer of the JWT, using the property 'yfs.jwt.<issuer name>.verify.keyloader.httpsuri'. Valid values: An http(s) URI to fetch the verification key for veifying the JWT signature

This property is applicable only when the property 'yfs.jwt.verify.keyloader' is set to either httpsjwks, httpsjwk or httpsbase64. It is the number of minutes to cache the response, which is obtained by the calling the URL configured using 'yfs.jwt.verify.keyloader.httpsuri', if the response header does not have any cache control directives. If cache control directives are present then this property will not be used. The value of this property should be greater than 0. Default value is 180 i.e. 3 hours. Default: 180

This property is applicable only when the property 'yfs.jwt.verify.keyloader' is set to either httpsjwks, httpsjwk or httpsbase64. It is the number of times to retry connecting to the URL configured using 'yfs.jwt.verify.keyloader.httpsuri', if the original request to the URL fails with a reason which may be recoverable. Default: 3 Sample setting: yfs.jwt.verify.key.uri.retry.count=3

This property is used to set comma separated string values indicating the allowed audience names. This property is used only when the incoming JWT contains a claim 'aud' (Audience). If present, the value of the 'aud' claim is validated against the allowed audiences configured using this property. Default: oms Example: yfs.jwt.verify.audience=audience1,aud2 Sample setting: yfs.jwt.verify.audience=oms

To specify a custom class which implements interface 'IPLTJWTClaimsParser'. Refer java docs for details.This class will be used to fetch a valid OMS user based on the claims present in the incoming JWT so that the same user can be used for authorization. If no value is specified for this property then default implementation is used. This property can also be configured for a specific issuer of the JWT, using the property 'yfs.jwt.<issuer name>.claimparser.class'.

This property is used only when no custom class is configured for property 'yfs.jwt.claimparser.class'. This is used to specify the path relative to the JWT body JSON to read the OMS user if it is present in the JWT claims. There is no default value. This property can also be configured for a specific issuer of the JWT, using the property 'yfs.jwt.<issuer name>.defclaimparser.user.path'. Example: if the JWT body json is {"iss" : "myissuer", "userinfo" : "anOmsUser", "userdata" : { "userEmail" : "fun@xyz.com" } } and the OMS user is present in the body with attribute "userinfo", then this property can be configured as yfs.jwt.defclaimparser.user.path=userinfo

This property is used only when no custom class is configured for property 'yfs.jwt.claimparser.class'. This is used to specify the path relative to the JWT body JSON to read the OMS user email id if it is present in the JWT claims. There is no default value. This property can also be configured for a specific issuer of the JWT, using the property 'yfs.jwt.<issuer name>.defclaimparser.user.email.path'. Example: if the JWT body json is {"iss" : "myissuer", "userinfo" : "anOmsUser", "userdata" : { "userEmail" : "fun@xyz.com" } } and the OMS user emailmid is present in the body with attribute "userEmail", then this property can be configured as yfs.jwt.defclaimparser.user.email.path=userdata.userEmail

This property is used specify comma separated oms users for which JWT authentication is not allowed. There is no default value for this property. Example: yfs.jwt.verify.block.users=user1,user2 Example: yfs.jwt.verify.block.users=user1

This property is used specify comma separated JWT issuer names for which JWT authentication is not allowed. There is no default value for this property. Example: yfs.jwt.verify.block.issuers=issuer1 Example: yfs.jwt.verify.block.issuers=issuer1,issuer2

This property is used specify comma separated key ids received in the incoming JWT, for which JWT authentication is not allowed. There is no default value for this property. Example: yfs.jwt.verify.block.kids=key_12346,xer10bfr Example: yfs.jwt.verify.block.kids=xer10bfr
Default behavior is a LOCAL API call. This may be set to HTTP or HTTPS instead.

Set the following userid and password to use basic authentication over HTTP or HTTPS UserId for basic authentication over HTTP or HTTPS
Set the following userid and password to use basic authentication over HTTP or HTTPS Password for basic authentication over HTTP or HTTPS
Set the following property if you are using HTTPS Set the location of the key store file, if you are using client side digital certificates
Set the following property if you are using HTTPS Set the location of the key store file, if you are using client side digital certificates
This property should be set for server certificate authentication The trust store is the location of the file where the server certificate root was imported
This property should be set for server certificate authentication The trust store is the location of the file where the server certificate root was imported

Disable verification of server certificates Sample setting: yif.httpapi.disableTrustStore=true

This property should always be set

The default method of authentication is through the web container. Set this property to change the authentication process. Valid values: CONTAINER : A user must be authenticated by the application container and a specific userid will be used. The property servlet.userid also to be set along with this. CONTAINER_USER : A user must be authenticated by the application container, and the identified Principal name will be used as the userid. This is the default setting. STANDARD : Pass _loginid and _tokenid (same idea as InteropHttpServlet's user token) BASIC : Pass Realm name and send user and password information encoded using the base64 algorithm in the Authorization header in the request. This will attempt to login to the system using the user credentials passed in the request. OPEN : Always use a given user, and perform no extra authentication checks. The property servlet.userid also to be set along with this. EXTENDED : Set the properties 'servlet.ssomanager' or 'yfs.login.singlesignon.class' to a custom SSO implementation of com.yantra.ycp.japi.util.YCPSSOManager interface.
PropertyMetadata.PermissibleValues: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <Values> <Value Name="CONTAINER"/> <Value Name="CONTAINER_USER"/> <Value Name="STANDARD"/> <Value Name="BASIC"/> <Value Name="OPEN"/> <Value Name="EXTENDED"/> </Values>

PropertyMetadata.Description: Set property to define the User id to call the Api. In real world it should be a user with Api invocation privileges.

Set property to define an implementation of com.yantra.ycp.japi.util.YCPSSOManager for a servlet.authstyle of EXTENDED type. This property is read before 'yfs.login.singlesignon.class' while retrieving the YCPSSOManager implementation class.
Set this property to 'true' to make modify calls with PUT request. The default value is 'false'.

Set this property to 'true' to enable JSON Web Token (JWT) based authentication for REST apis. If this property is set to true, and a valid Bearer token is received in Authorization header, then JWT authentication is given preference over other ways of authentication configured by property 'servlet.authstyle'. The default value is 'false'.
Set this property to 'true' to enable Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) support for REST apis. The default value is 'false'.

Set this property to time (in seconds), the results of CORS preflight request should be cached in a preflight results cache by the browser. This corresponds to the http response header 'Access-Control-Max-Age'.This is applicable only if 'servlet.cors.enabled' is set to true. The default value is 3600 i.e. 1 hour.

Set this property to 'true' to signal the browser to allow to send credentials to the server in a CORS request. This corresponds to the http response header 'Access-Control-Allow-Credentials'.This is applicable only if 'servlet.cors.enabled' is set to true. The default value is 'true'.

Set this property to specify comma-separated origin values which are allowed for CORS. The origin can be in the format 'protocol://host_name:[port]', where the port number is optional. The property can accept a single value of wildcard (*) to permit access for any origin. This corresponds to the http response header 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin'.This is applicable only if 'servlet.cors.enabled' is set to true. The default value is *.

Set this property to specify comma separated HTTP headers that can be accessed by a browser while making a CORS request. This corresponds to the http response header 'Access-Control-Expose-Headers'.This is applicable only if 'servlet.cors.enabled' is set to true. The default value is not set hence the header 'Access-Control-Expose-Headers' is not sent in response by default.

Set this property to specify comma separated allowed HTTP request headers which are returned in response to a CORS preflight request. This corresponds to the http response header 'Access-Control-Allow-Headers'.This is applicable only if 'servlet.cors.enabled' is set to true. The default value is same as the value of the incoming request header 'Access-Control-Request-Headers'

Set this property to specify comma separated allowed HTTP request methods which are returned in response to a CORS preflight request. This corresponds to the http response header 'Access-Control-Allow-Methods'.This is applicable only if 'servlet.cors.enabled' is set to true. The default the value is same as the value of the incoming request header 'Access-Control-Request-Method'

PropertyMetadata.Description: Property is only applicable when yfs.hotsku.lockItemOnInventoryChanges is "N". This property is set to "Y" to commit inventory updates to the DB after API output and at the end of the transaction. If this property is set to "N", then inventory updates are only committed to the DB at the end of the transaction.
Set this property to "Y" to allow the syncLoadedInventory API to correctly calculate inventory changes when there are multiple records in YFS_INVENTORY_ITEM for the same item / node combination.

Set this property to "Y" to enable granular locking for inventory item. OLA needs to be enabled to use this feature. It is recommended to set yfs.hotsku.assumeUnavailableOnLockTimeout=Y with this feature.
Set this property to a suitable value (2 or above) for attempts before considering item unavailable
Set this property to a Y if you availability to be considered across inquired nodes. Set N for considering availability high or low at each location individually.
Set this property to "true" to push capacity updates to end of transaction, thus reducing lock contention on resource pool consumption table.
This property determines whether to close statements proactively when doing inventory updates. This property is only applicable when yfs.hotsku.lockItemOnInventoryChanges=N.

PropertyMetadata.Description: Determines the number of constraint failures before giving up and going with the current best option. If the promising optimization engine hasn't found a best option, it will continue to process until it finds one.

Determines whether the promising optimization engine should consider generating options even if backordered quantity increases. If this is not set and yfs.solver.MaxChoiceFailures is set, then this will be assumed Y. Valid values: Y: Generate options with more backordered quantity. N: Avoid generating options with more backordered quantity.

Determines whether the promising optimization engine should consider generating options where the number of shipments increases when optimizing with Landed Cost. If this is not set and yfs.solver.MaxChoiceFailures is set, then this will be assumed Y. Valid values: Y: Generate options with more shipments. N: Avoid generating options with more shipments.

Valid values: Y: Publisher service is started during Application/Agent server start. N: Publisher service is not started during Application/Agent server start. Default value is N. Setting the property to yfs.payment.processReturnOrderCompleteTraversalRequired=Y will trigger the below flow for processReturnOrder or computeRefundPayments API. When run, this API will default all payment methods from the sales orders linked to this return(Immediate parent), (these will be ignored if the return is a gift return), and considering the payments on the sales orders, as well as any amount on the return not linked to a sales order, will compute how the system would refund the return considering limits of usage of payment methods and how much is being refunded from each sales order. The amount to refund will be stamped as the PlannedRefundAmount on each of the return order payment methods . If there are still amount remaining to return for which a planned refund amount was not computed, system will now traverse up the chain for linked returns and exchange order till the first Sales order from which the return was initiated. System will get all the linked sales and exchange orders and copy payment tenders that are valid for return from this set to the return order that is being processed. System will now calculate the planned refund on the payment method starting from the very first Sales order.

A yfs.calcPlanRefForAllSuppressRefSettleWaitTillReturnInv property is introduced. By default the value for yfs.calcPlanRefForAllSuppressRefSettleWaitTillReturnInv is set to N. To enable the enhancement, set the property to Y Enable this property in the processReturnOrder API to calculate the planned refund amount for the payment methods with configuration refund to the "New Payment method". With planned refund amount populated for the payment methods, system creates the refund charges without return order invoice. Setting this property to Y suppresses the creation of refund charges until the return order invoice is created.

yfs.objectmap.extension.file property is used for objectmap properties.If the default implementation is used ObjectMap.properties file will be loaded OOB. If the property is declared through the customer_overrides.properties the custom file value needs to be declared . The custom file will be used to override the complete EhCache.xml values . So the custom file needs to respect the format of EhCache.xml

If the property is declared through the customer_overrides.properties the custom file value needs to be declared . Accordingly the meta custom properties will be updated or added to the cachetypes.

If the property is declared through the customer_overrides.properties the custom file value needs to be declared .
